info.title: IAM Access Groups
info.description: The IAM Access Groups API allows for the management of access groups (Create, Read, Update, Delete) as well as the management of memberships and rules within the group container.

tags.name: Membership operations
tags.description: Operations related to access group membership.

tags.name: Rule operations
tags.description: Operations related to access group rules.

tags.name: Template operations
tags.description: Operations related to enterprise-managed access group templates.

tags.name: Template assignment operations
tags.description: Operations related to enterprise-managed access group template assignments.

post.description: Create a new access group to assign multiple users and service ids to multiple policies. The group will be created in the account specified by the `account_id` parameter. The group name is a required field, but a description is optional. Because the group's name does not have to be unique, it is possible to create multiple groups with the same name.

Location.description: Path to the created group resource

ETag.description: The revision number of the group

errors.message: An access group with the name <name> already exists. Enter a different name.

source:
curl -X POST --location --header "Authorization: Bearer {iam_token}" \
  --header "Accept: application/json" \
  --header "Content-Type: application/json" \
  --data '{ "name": "Managers", "description": "Group for managers" }' \
  "{base_url}/v2/groups?account_id={account_id}"

createAccessGroupOptions := iamAccessGroupsService.NewCreateAccessGroupOptions(
  testAccountID,
  "Managers",
)
createAccessGroupOptions.SetDescription("Group for managers")

group, response, err := iamAccessGroupsService.CreateAccessGroup(createAccessGroupOptions)
if err != nil {
  panic(err)
}
b, _ := json.MarshalIndent(group, "", "  ")
fmt.Println(string(b))

group = iam_access_groups_service.create_access_group(
  account_id=test_account_id,
  name='Managers',
  description='Group for managers'
).get_result()

print(json.dumps(group, indent=2))

get.description: This API lists access groups within an account. Parameters for pagination and sorting can be used to filter the results. The `account_id` query parameter determines which account to retrieve groups from. Only the groups you have access to are returned (either because of a policy on a specific group or account level access (admin, editor, or viewer)). There may be more groups in the account that aren't shown if you lack the aforementioned permissions.

parameters.description: Return groups for member ID (IBMid, service ID or trusted profile ID).
parameters.name: iam_id

parameters.description:
Use search to filter access groups list by id, name or description.
* `search=id:<ACCESS_GROUP_ID>` - To list access groups by id
* `search=name:<ACCESS_GROUP_NAME>` - To list access groups by name
* `search=description:<ACCESS_GROUP_DESC>` - To list access groups by description
parameters.name: search

parameters.description: Membership type need to be specified along with iam_id and must be either `static`, `dynamic` or `all`. If membership type is `static`, members explicitly added to the group will be shown. If membership type is `dynamic`, members accessing the access group at the moment via dynamic rules will be shown. If membership type is `all`, both static and dynamic members will be shown.
parameters.name: membership_type

parameters.description: Return up to this limit of results where limit is between 0 and 100.
parameters.name: limit

parameters.description: The offset of the first result item to be returned.
parameters.name: offset

parameters.description: Sort the results by id, name, description, or is_federated flag.
parameters.name: sort
show_federated
parameters.description: If show_federated is true, each group listed will return an is_federated value that is set to true if rules exist for the group.

parameters.name: hide_public_access
parameters.description: If hide_public_access is true, do not include the Public Access Group in the results.

groups.name: Public Access
groups.description: This group includes all users and service IDs by default. All group members, including unauthenticated users, are given public access to any resources that are defined in the policies for the group.

source:
curl -X GET --location --header "Authorization: Bearer {iam_token}" \
  --header "Accept: application/json" \
  "{base_url}/v2/groups?account_id={account_id}"

all_results = []
pager = AccessGroupsPager(
  client=iam_access_groups_service,
  account_id=test_account_id,
)
while pager.has_next():
  next_page = pager.get_next()
  assert next_page is not None
  all_results.extend(next_page)

print(json.dumps(all_results, indent=2))

get.description: Retrieve an access group by its `access_group_id`. Only the groups data is returned (group name, description, account_id, ...), not membership or rule information. A revision number is returned in the `ETag` header, which is needed when updating the access group.

parameters.name: show_federated
parameters.description: If show_federated is true, the group will return an is_federated value that is set to true if rules exist for the group.

ETag.description: The revision number needed to update the group.

source:
curl -X GET --location --header "Authorization: Bearer {iam_token}" \
  --header "Accept: application/json" \
  "{base_url}/v2/groups/{access_group_id}"

response = iam_access_groups_service.get_access_group(
  access_group_id=test_group_id
)
group = response.get_result()

print(json.dumps(group, indent=2))

patch.description: Update the group name or description of an existing access group using this API. An `If-Match` header must be populated with the group's most recent revision number (which can be acquired in the `Get an access group` API).

parameters.description: The current revision number of the group being updated. This can be found in the Create/Get access group response ETag header.
parameters.name: If-Match

errors.message: An access group with the name <name> already exists. Enter a different name.

source:
curl -X PATCH --location --header "Authorization: Bearer {iam_token}" \
  --header "Accept: application/json" \
  --header "If-Match: accessGroupETagLink" \
  --header "Content-Type: application/json" \
  --data '{ "name": "Awesome Managers", "description": "Group for awesome managers." }' \
  "{base_url}/v2/groups/{access_group_id}"

updateAccessGroupOptions := iamAccessGroupsService.NewUpdateAccessGroupOptions(
  accessGroupIDLink,
  accessGroupETagLink,
)
updateAccessGroupOptions.SetName("Awesome Managers")
updateAccessGroupOptions.SetDescription("Group for awesome managers.")

group, response, err := iamAccessGroupsService.UpdateAccessGroup(updateAccessGroupOptions)
if err != nil {
  panic(err)
}
b, _ := json.MarshalIndent(group, "", "  ")
fmt.Println(string(b))

group = iam_access_groups_service.update_access_group(
  access_group_id=test_group_id,
  if_match=test_group_etag,
  name='Awesome Managers',
  description='Group for awesome managers'
).get_result()

print(json.dumps(group, indent=2))

delete.description: This API is used for deleting an access group. If the access group has no members or rules associated with it, the group and its policies will be deleted. However, if rules or members do exist, set the `force` parameter to true to delete the group as well as its associated members, rules, and policies.

parameters.description: If force is true, delete the group as well as its associated members and rules.
parameters.name: force

source: curl -X DELETE --location --header "Authorization: Bearer {iam_token}" \
"{base_url}/v2/groups/{access_group_id}"

response = iam_access_groups_service.delete_access_group(
  access_group_id=test_group_id

put.summary: Add members to an access group
put.description: Use this API to add users (`IBMid-...`), service IDs (`iam-ServiceId-...`) or trusted profiles (`iam-Profile-...`) to an access group. Any member added gains access to resources defined in the group's policies. To revoke a given members's access, simply remove them from the group. There is no limit to the number of members one group can have, but each `iam_id` can only be added to 50 groups. Additionally, this API request payload can add up to 50 members per call.

requestBody.description: List of members to add to the group. This field has a limit of 50 members.

207.description: There is a multiple status response. Please check the response body.

errors.message: The service id is missing or incorrect

400.description: Bad Input (Including duplicate members in request).

source:
curl -X PUT --location --header "Authorization: Bearer {iam_token}" \
  --header "Accept: application/json" \
  --header "Content-Type: application/json" \
  --data '{ "members": [ { "iam_id": "IBMid-user1", "type": "user" }, { "iam_id": "iam-ServiceId-123", "type": "service" }, { "iam_id": "iam-Profile-123", "type": "profile" } ] }' \
  "{base_url}/v2/groups/{access_group_id}/members"

member1 = AddGroupMembersRequestMembersItem(
  iam_id='IBMid-user1', type='user')
member2 = AddGroupMembersRequestMembersItem(
  iam_id='iam-ServiceId-123', type='service')
member3 = AddGroupMembersRequestMembersItem(
  iam_id=test_profile_id, type='profile')
members = [member1, member2, member3]

add_group_members_response = iam_access_groups_service.add_members_to_access_group(
  access_group_id=test_group_id,
  members=members
).get_result()

print(json.dumps(add_group_members_response, indent=2))

get.description: List all members of a given group using this API. Parameters for pagination and sorting can be used to filter the results. The most useful query parameter may be the `verbose` flag. If `verbose=true`, user, service ID and trusted profile names will be retrieved for each `iam_id`. If performance is a concern, leave the `verbose` parameter off so that name information does not get retrieved.

parameters.name: membership_type
parameters.description: Filters members by membership type. Filter by `static`, `dynamic` or `all`. `static` lists the members explicitly added to the access group, and `dynamic` lists the members that are part of the access group at that time via dynamic rules. `all` lists both static and dynamic members.
Return up to this limit of results where limit is between 0 and 100.
parameters.name: limit

parameters.description: The offset of the first result item to be returned.
parameters.name: offset

parameters.description: Filter the results by member type.
parameters.name: type

parameters.description: Return user's email and name for each user ID or the name for each service ID or trusted profile.
parameters.name: verbose

parameters.description: If verbose is true, sort the results by id, name, or email.
parameters.name: sort

members.name: Service ID 1
members.description: This is the description of the service id.

members.name: Trusted Profile 1
members.description: This is the description of the trusted profile.

source:
curl -X GET --location --header "Authorization: Bearer {iam_token}" \
  --header "Accept: application/json" \
  "{base_url}/v2/groups/{access_group_id}/members"

all_results = []
pager = AccessGroupMembersPager(
  client=iam_access_groups_service,
  access_group_id=test_group_id,
)
while pager.has_next():
  next_page = pager.get_next()
  assert next_page is not None
  all_results.extend(next_page)

print(json.dumps(all_results, indent=2))

head.summary: Check membership in an access group
head.description: This HEAD operation determines if a given `iam_id` is present in a group either explicitly or via dynamic rules. No response body is returned with this request. If the membership exists, a `204 - No Content` status code is returned. If the membership or the group does not exist, a `404 - Not Found` status code is returned.

source: curl -X HEAD --location --header "Authorization: Bearer {iam_token}" \
"{base_url}/v2/groups/{access_group_id}/members/{iam_id}"

response = iam_access_groups_service.is_member_of_access_group(
  access_group_id=test_group_id,
  iam_id='IBMid-user1'

delete.summary: Delete member from an access group
delete.description: Remove one member from a group using this API. If the operation is successful, only a `204 - No Content` response with no body is returned. However, if any error occurs, the standard error format will be returned. Dynamic member cannot be deleted using this API. Dynamic rules needs to be adjusted to delete dynamic members.

errors.message: Failed to find the specified access group: <id>
Cannot delete group membership for: AccessGroupId-PublicAccess

source: curl -X DELETE --location --header "Authorization: Bearer {iam_token}" \
"{base_url}/v2/groups/{access_group_id}/members/{iam_id}"

response = iam_access_groups_service.remove_member_from_access_group(
  access_group_id=test_group_id,
  iam_id='IBMid-user1'

post.summary: Delete members from an access group
post.description: Remove multiple members from a group using this API. On a successful call, this API will always return 207. It is the caller's responsibility to iterate across the body to determine successful deletion of each member. This API request payload can delete up to 50 members per call. This API doesnt delete dynamic members accessing the access group via dynamic rules.

207.description: There is a multiple status response. Please check the response body.

400.description: Bad Input (Including duplicate members in request).

source:
curl -X POST --location --header "Authorization: Bearer {iam_token}" \
  --header "Accept: application/json" \
  --header "Content-Type: application/json" \
  --data '{ "members": [ "IBMId-user1", "iam-ServiceId-123", "iam-Profile-123" ] }' \
  "{base_url}/v2/groups/{access_group_id}/members/delete"

delete_group_bulk_members_response = iam_access_groups_service.remove_members_from_access_group(
  access_group_id=test_group_id,
  members=['iam-ServiceId-123']
).get_result()

print(json.dumps(delete_group_bulk_members_response, indent=2))


delete_group_bulk_members_response = iam_access_groups_service.remove_members_from_access_group(
  access_group_id=test_group_id,
  members=[test_profile_id]
).get_result()

print(json.dumps(delete_group_bulk_members_response, indent=2))

delete.summary: Delete member from all access groups
delete.description: This API removes a given member from every group they are a member of within the specified account. By using one operation, you can revoke one member's access to all access groups in the account. If a partial failure occurs on deletion, the response will be shown in the body.

207.description: There is a multiple status response. Please check the response body.

source:
curl -X DELETE --location --header "Authorization: Bearer {iam_token}" \
  --header "Accept: application/json" \
  "{base_url}/v2/groups/_allgroups/members/{iam_id}?account_id={account_id}"

delete_from_all_groups_response = iam_access_groups_service.remove_member_from_all_access_groups(
  account_id=test_account_id,
  iam_id='IBMid-user1'
).get_result()

print(json.dumps(delete_from_all_groups_response, indent=2))

put.summary: Add member to multiple access groups
put.description: This API will add a member to multiple access groups in an account. The limit of how many groups that can be in the request is 50. The response is a list of results that show if adding the member to each group was successful or not.

requestBody.description: List of groups in the account the member should be added to.

207.description: There is a multiple status response. Please check the response body.

errors.message: Forbidden: You don't have the required access to complete this action. Contact your account owner for access

400.description: Bad Input (Including duplicate groups in request).

errors.message: A duplicate groupId entry was found for AccessGroupId-f1d04900-0afd-4989-bb8d-4b58cf454f42. Please remove any duplicate entries.

source:
curl -X PUT --location --header "Authorization: Bearer {iam_token}" \
  --header "Accept: application/json" \
  --header "Content-Type: application/json" \
  --data '{ "type": "user", "groups": [ "AccessGroupId-b0d32f56-f85c-4bf1-af37-7bbd92b1b2b3" ] }' \
  "{base_url}/v2/groups/_allgroups/members/{iam_id}?account_id={account_id}"

addMemberToMultipleAccessGroupsOptions := iamAccessGroupsService.NewAddMemberToMultipleAccessGroupsOptions(
  testAccountID,
  "IBMid-user1",
)

addMemberToMultipleAccessGroupsOptions.SetType("user")
addMemberToMultipleAccessGroupsOptions.SetGroups([]string{accessGroupIDLink})

addMembershipMultipleGroupsResponse, response, err := iamAccessGroupsService.AddMemberToMultipleAccessGroups(addMemberToMultipleAccessGroupsOptions)
if err != nil {
  panic(err)
}
b, _ := json.MarshalIndent(addMembershipMultipleGroupsResponse, "", "  ")
fmt.Println(string(b))

add_membership_multiple_groups_response = iam_access_groups_service.add_member_to_multiple_access_groups(
  account_id=test_account_id,
  iam_id='IBMid-user1',
  type='user',
  groups=[test_group_id]
).get_result()

print(json.dumps(add_membership_multiple_groups_response, indent=2))

post.summary: Create rule for an access group
post.description: Rules can be used to dynamically add users to an access group. If a user's SAML assertions match the rule's conditions during login, the user will be dynamically added to the group. The duration of the user's access to the group is determined by the `expiration` field. After access expires, the user will need to log in again to regain access. Note that the condition's value field must be a stringified JSON value. [Consult this documentation for further explanation of dynamic rules.](/docs/account?topic=account-rules)

Location.description: Path to the created rule resource.

ETag.description: The revision number of the group.

source:
curl -X POST --location --header "Authorization: Bearer {iam_token}" \
  --header "Accept: application/json" \
  --header "Content-Type: application/json" \
  --data '{ "name": "Manager group rule", "expiration": 12, "realm_name": "https://idp.example.org/SAML2", "conditions": [ { "claim": "isManager", "operator": "EQUALS", "value": "true" } ] }' \
  "{base_url}/v2/groups/{access_group_id}/rules"

ruleConditionsModel := &iamaccessgroupsv2.RuleConditions{
  Claim:    core.StringPtr("isManager"),
  Operator: core.StringPtr("EQUALS"),
  Value:    core.StringPtr("true"),
}

addAccessGroupRuleOptions := iamAccessGroupsService.NewAddAccessGroupRuleOptions(
  accessGroupIDLink,
  int64(12),
  "https://idp.example.org/SAML2a",
  []iamaccessgroupsv2.RuleConditions{*ruleConditionsModel},
)
addAccessGroupRuleOptions.SetName("Manager group rule")

rule, response, err := iamAccessGroupsService.AddAccessGroupRule(addAccessGroupRuleOptions)
if err != nil {
  panic(err)
}
b, _ := json.MarshalIndent(rule, "", "  ")
fmt.Println(string(b))

rule_conditions_model = {
  'claim': 'isManager',
  'operator': 'EQUALS',
  'value': 'true'
}

rule = iam_access_groups_service.add_access_group_rule(
  access_group_id=test_group_id,
  name='Manager group rule',
  expiration=12,
  realm_name='https://idp.example.org/SAML2"',
  conditions=[rule_conditions_model]
).get_result()

print(json.dumps(rule, indent=2))

get.description: This API lists all rules in a given access group. Because only a few rules are created on each group, there is no pagination or sorting support on this API.

200.description: List all rules in the given access group.

source:
curl -X GET --location --header "Authorization: Bearer {iam_token}" \
  --header "Accept: application/json" \
  "{base_url}/v2/groups/{access_group_id}/rules"

rules_list = iam_access_groups_service.list_access_group_rules(
  access_group_id=test_group_id
).get_result()

print(json.dumps(rules_list, indent=2))

parameters.name: rule_id
parameters.description: The rule to get.

get.description: Retrieve a rule from an access group. A revision number is returned in the `ETag` header, which is needed when updating the rule.

ETag.description: The revision number needed to update the rule.

source:
curl -X GET --location --header "Authorization: Bearer {iam_token}" \
  --header "Accept: application/json" \
  "{base_url}/v2/groups/{access_group_id}/rules/{rule_id}"

response = iam_access_groups_service.get_access_group_rule(
  access_group_id=test_group_id,
  rule_id=test_claim_rule_id
)
rule = response.get_result()

print(json.dumps(rule, indent=2))

put.description: Update the body of an existing rule using this API. An `If-Match` header must be populated with the rule's most recent revision number (which can be acquired in the `Get an access group rule` API).

parameters.name: If-Match
parameters.description: The current revision number of the rule being updated. This can be found in the Get Rule response ETag header.

ETag.description: The revision number of the updated rule.

source:
curl -X PUT --location --header "Authorization: Bearer {iam_token}" \
  --header "Accept: application/json" \
  --header "If-Match: {if_match}" \
  --header "Content-Type: application/json" \
  --data '{ "name": "Manager group rule", "expiration": 12, "realm_name": "https://idp.example.org/SAML2", "conditions": [ { "claim": "isManager", "operator": "EQUALS", "value": "true" } ] }' \
  "{base_url}/v2/groups/{access_group_id}/rules/{rule_id}"

ruleConditionsModel := &iamaccessgroupsv2.RuleConditions{
  Claim:    core.StringPtr("isManager"),
  Operator: core.StringPtr("EQUALS"),
  Value:    core.StringPtr("true"),
}

replaceAccessGroupRuleOptions := iamAccessGroupsService.NewReplaceAccessGroupRuleOptions(
  accessGroupIDLink,
  testClaimRuleID,
  testClaimRuleEtag,
  int64(12),
  "https://idp.example.org/SAML2",
  []iamaccessgroupsv2.RuleConditions{*ruleConditionsModel},
)
replaceAccessGroupRuleOptions.SetName("Manager group rule")

rule, response, err := iamAccessGroupsService.ReplaceAccessGroupRule(replaceAccessGroupRuleOptions)
if err != nil {
  panic(err)
}
b, _ := json.MarshalIndent(rule, "", "  ")
fmt.Println(string(b))

RuleConditions ruleConditionsModel = new RuleConditions.Builder()
  .claim("isManager")
  .operator("EQUALS")
  .value("true")
  .build();
ReplaceAccessGroupRuleOptions replaceAccessGroupRuleOptions = new ReplaceAccessGroupRuleOptions.Builder()
  .accessGroupId(testGroupId)
  .ruleId(testClaimRuleId)
  .ifMatch(testClaimRuleETag)
  .name("Manager group rule")
  .expiration(24)
  .realmName("https://idp.example.org/SAML2\"")
  .addConditions(ruleConditionsModel)
  .build();

Response<Rule> response = iamAccessGroupsService.replaceAccessGroupRule(replaceAccessGroupRuleOptions).execute();
Rule rule = response.getResult();

System.out.println(rule);

rule_conditions_model = {
  'claim': 'isManager',
  'operator': 'EQUALS',
  'value': 'true'
}

rule = iam_access_groups_service.replace_access_group_rule(
  access_group_id=test_group_id,
  rule_id=test_claim_rule_id,
  if_match=test_claim_rule_etag,
  name='Manager group rule',
  expiration=24,
  realm_name='https://idp.example.org/SAML2a',
  conditions=[rule_conditions_model]
).get_result()

print(json.dumps(rule, indent=2))

delete.description: Remove one rule from a group using this API. If the operation is successful, only a `204 - No Content` response with no body is returned. However, if any error occurs, the standard error format will be returned.

source: curl -X DELETE --location --header "Authorization: Bearer {iam_token}" \
"{base_url}/v2/groups/{access_group_id}/rules/{rule_id}"

response = iam_access_groups_service.remove_access_group_rule(
  access_group_id=test_group_id,
  rule_id=test_claim_rule_id

get.description: Retrieve the access groups settings for a specific account.

errors.message: The account id, c56eec94cb5793b8da0eb7790759aaf0, is invalid

source:
curl -X GET --location --header "Authorization: Bearer {iam_token}" \
  --header "Accept: application/json" \
  "{base_url}/v2/groups/settings?account_id={account_id}"

account_settings = iam_access_groups_service.get_account_settings(
  account_id=test_account_id
).get_result()

print(json.dumps(account_settings, indent=2))


account_settings = ibm_cloud_shell_service.get_account_settings(
  account_id=account_id
).get_result()

print(json.dumps(account_settings, indent=2))


account_settings = context_based_restrictions_service.get_account_settings(
  account_id=account_id
).get_result()

print(json.dumps(account_settings, indent=2))

patch.description: Update the access groups settings for a specific account. Note: When the `public_access_enabled` setting is set to false, all policies within the account attached to the Public Access group will be deleted. Only set `public_access_enabled` to false if you are sure that you want those policies to be removed.

errors.message: Payload contains invalid/missing data. Reason: `Unexpected fields are present in the request body.`

source:
curl -X PATCH --location --header "Authorization: Bearer {iam_token}" \
  --header "Accept: application/json" \
  --header "Content-Type: application/json" \
  --data '{ "public_access_enabled": true }' \
  "{base_url}/v2/groups/settings?account_id={account_id}"

post.description: Create an access group template. Make sure that the template is generic enough to apply to multiple different child accounts. Before you can assign an access group template to child accounts, you must commit it so that no further changes can be made to the version.

example.name: IAM Admin Group template
example.description: This access group template allows admin access to all IAM platform services in the account.

group.name: IAM Admin Group
group.description: This access group template allows admin access to all IAM platform services in the account.

parameters.name: Transaction-Id
parameters.description: An optional transaction id for the request

Transaction-Id.description: An optional transaction id for the request

example.name: IAM Admin Group template
example.description: This template allows admin access to all IAM platform service.

group.name: IAM Admin Group
group.description: This AG allows admin access to all IAM platform services.

source:
curl -X POST --location --header "Authorization: Bearer {iam_token}" \
  --header "Accept: application/json" \
  --header "Content-Type: application/json" \
  --data '{ "name": "IAM Admin Group template", "description": "This access group template allows admin access to all IAM platform services in the account.", "account_id": "accountID-123", "group": { "name": "IAM Admin Group", "description": "This access group template allows admin access to all IAM platform services in the account.", "members": { "users": [ "IBMid-50PJGPKYJJ", "IBMid-665000T8WY" ], "services": [ "iam-ServiceId-345", "iam-ServiceId-456" ], "action_controls": { "add": true, "remove": false } }, "assertions": { "rules": [ { "name": "Manager group rule", "expiration": 12, "realm_name": "https://idp.example.org/SAML2", "conditions": [ { "claim": "blueGroup", "operator": "CONTAINS", "value": "test-bluegroup-saml" } ], "action_controls": { "remove": false } }, { "name": "Developer group rule", "expiration": 12, "realm_name": "https://idp.example.org/SAML2", "conditions": [ { "claim": "yellowGroup", "operator": "CONTAINS", "value": "test-yellowGroup-saml" } ] } ], "action_controls": { "add": false, "remove": true } }, "action_controls": { "access": { "add": false } } }, "policy_template_references": [ { "id": "policyTemplateId-123", "version": "1" }, { "id": "policyTemplateId-234", "version": "1" } ] }' \
  "{base_url}/v1/group_templates"

AccountIdParam.name: account_id
AccountIdParam.description: Account ID of the API keys(s) to query. If a service IAM ID is specified in iam_id then account_id must match the account of the IAM ID. If a user IAM ID is specified in iam_id then then account_id must match the account of the Authorization token.

TransactionIdHeaderParam.name: Transaction-Id
TransactionIdHeaderParam.description: An optional transaction ID can be passed to your request, which can be useful for tracking calls through multiple services by using one identifier. The header key must be set to Transaction-Id and the value is anything that you choose. If no transaction ID is passed in, then a random ID is generated.

ErrorContainer.description: ErrorContainer contains the Transaction-Id, status code, and an array of errors that are being returned to the user.

status_code.description: The HTTP status code of the response.

errors.description: List of errors encountered in the service request.

Error.description: Error contains the code and message for an error returned to the user code is a string identifying the problem, examples "missing_field", "reserved_value" message is a string explaining the solution to the problem that was encountered.

code.description: A human-readable error code represented by a snake case string.

message.description: A specific error message that details the issue or an action to take.

href.description: A string containing the links URL.

CreateGroupRequest.description: Name of the access to group to be created and a description.

name.description: Give the access group a unique name that doesn't conflict with an existing access group in the account. This field is case-insensitive and has a limit of 100 characters.

description.description: Assign an optional description for the access group. This field has a limit of 250 characters.

UpdateGroupRequest.description: The new name and description of the access group.

name.description: Give the access group a unique name that doesn't conflict with an existing access group in the account. This field is case-insensitive and has a limit of 100 characters.

description.description: Assign an optional description for the access group. This field has a limit of 250 characters.

account_id.description: The account id where the group was created.

created_at.description: The timestamp of when the group was created.

created_by_id.description: The `iam_id` of the entity that created the group.

last_modified_at.description: The timestamp of when the group was last edited.

last_modified_by_id.description: The `iam_id` of the entity that last modified the group name or description.

href.description: A url to the given group resource.

is_federated.description: This is set to true if rules exist for the group.

GroupsList.description: The list of access groups returned as part of a response.

limit.description: Limit on how many items can be returned.

offset.description: The offset of the first item returned in the result set.

total_count.description: The total number of items that match the query.

AddGroupMembersRequest.description: An array of member objects to add to an access group.

members.description: An array of member objects to add to an access group.

iam_id.description: The IBMid, service ID or trusted profile ID of the member.

type.description: The type of the member, must be either "user", "service" or "profile".

AddMembershipMultipleGroupsRequest.description: A list of different access groups to add a given member, and the given member's type.

type.description: The type of the member, must be either "user", "service" or "profile".

groups.description: The ids of the access groups a given member is to be added to.

AddMembershipMultipleGroupsResponse.description: The response from the add member to multiple access groups request.

groups.description: The list of access groups a member was added to.

access_group_id.description: The access group that the member is to be added to.

status_code.description: The outcome of the add membership operation on this `access_group_id`.

trace.description: A transaction-id that can be used for debugging purposes.

errors.description: List of errors encountered when adding member to access group.

AddGroupMembersResponse.description: The members added to an access group.

members.description: The members added to an access group.

iam_id.description: The IBMid or Service Id of the member.

created_at.description: The timestamp of when the membership was created.

created_by_id.description: The `iam_id` of the entity that created the membership.

status_code.description: The outcome of the operation on this `iam_id`.

trace.description: A transaction-id that can be used for debugging purposes.

errors.description: A list of errors that occurred when trying to add members to a group.

DeleteFromAllGroupsResponse.description: The response from the delete member from access groups request.

iam_id.description: The `iam_id` of the member to removed from groups.

groups.description: The groups the member was removed from.

access_group_id.description: The access group that the member is to be deleted from.

status_code.description: The outcome of the delete operation on this `access_group_id`.

trace.description: A transaction-id that can be used for debugging purposes.

errors.description: A list of errors that occurred when trying to remove a member from groups.

DeleteGroupBulkMembersRequest.description: The members to remove from an access group.

members.description: The `iam_id`s to remove from the access group. This field has a limit of 50 `iam_id`s.

items.description: An `iam_id` to remove from the access group.

DeleteGroupBulkMembersResponse.description: The access group id and the members removed from it.

members.description: The `iam_id`s removed from the access group.

trace.description: A transaction-id that can be used for debugging purposes.

status_code.description: The outcome of the delete membership operation on this `access_group_id`.

errors.description: A list of errors that occurred when trying to remove a member from groups.

limit.description: Limit on how many items can be returned.

offset.description: The offset of the first item returned in the result set.

total_count.description: The total number of items that match the query.

members.description: The members of an access group.

ListGroupMembersResponseMember.description: A single member of an access group in a list.

iam_id.description: The IBMid or Service Id of the member.

name.description: The user's or service id's name.

email.description: If the member type is user, this is the user's email.

description.description: If the member type is service, this is the service id's description.

href.description: A url to the given member resource.

created_at.description: The timestamp the membership was created at.

created_by_id.description: The `iam_id` of the entity that created the membership.

RuleRequest.description: A new dynamic rule to add to an access group.

name.description: The name of the dynaimic rule.

expiration.description: Session duration in hours. Access group membership is revoked after this time period expires. Users must log back in to refresh their access group membership.

realm_name.description: The URL of the identity provider (IdP).

conditions.description: A list of conditions that identities must satisfy to gain access group membership.

Rule.description: A dynamic rule of an access group.

expiration.description: Session duration in hours. Access group membership is revoked after this time period expires. Users must log back in to refresh their access group membership. Must be between 1 and 24.

realm_name.description: The URL of the identity provider.

access_group_id.description: The group id that the dynamic rule is assigned to.

account_id.description: The account id that the group is in.

conditions.description: A list of conditions that identities must satisfy to gain access group membership.

created_at.description: The timestamp for when the rule was created.

created_by_id.description: The `iam_id` of the entity that created the dynamic rule.

last_modified_at.description: The timestamp for when the dynamic rule was last edited.

last_modified_by_id.description: The IAM id that last modified the rule.

RuleConditions.description: The conditions of a dynamic rule.

claim.description: The claim to evaluate against. This will be found in the `ext` claims of a user's login request.

operator.description: The operation to perform on the claim.

value.description: The stringified JSON value that the claim is compared to using the operator.

RulesList.description: A list of dynamic rules attached to the access group.

AccountSettingsRequest.description: The access groups settings for a specific account.

public_access_enabled.description: This flag controls the public access feature within the account. It is set to true by default. Note: When this flag is set to false, all policies within the account attached to the Public Access group will be deleted.

AccountSettings.description: The access groups settings for a specific account.

account_id.description: The account id of the settings being shown.

last_modified_at.description: The timestamp the settings were last edited at.

last_modified_by_id.description: The `iam_id` of the entity that last modified the settings.

public_access_enabled.description: This flag controls the public access feature within the account. It is set to true by default. Note: When this flag is set to false, all policies within the account attached to the Public Access group will be deleted.

MembersActionControls.description: Control whether or not access group administrators in child accounts can add and remove members from the enterprise-managed access group in their account.

add.description:
Action control for adding child account members to an enterprise-managed access group. If an access group administrator in a child account adds a member, they can always remove them.
Note that if conflicts arise between an update to this control in a new version and members added by an administrator in the child account, you must resolve those conflicts in the child account. This prevents breaking access in the child account. For more information, see [Working with versions] (https://cloud.ibm.com/docs/secure-enterprise?topic=secure-enterprise-working-with-versions#new-version-scenarios).

remove.description:
Action control for removing enterprise-managed members from an enterprise-managed access group.
Note that if an enterprise member is removed from an enterprise-managed access group in a child account and you reassign the template, the membership is reinstated.

RuleActionControls.description: Control whether or not access group administrators in child accounts can update and remove this dynamic rule in the enterprise-managed access group in their account.This overrides outer level AssertionsActionControls.

remove.description: Action control for removing this enterprise-managed dynamic rule

AssertionsActionControls.description: Control whether or not access group administrators in child accounts can add, remove, and update dynamic rules for the enterprise-managed access group in their account. The inner level RuleActionControls override these `remove` and `update` action controls.

add.description:
Action control for adding dynamic rules to an enterprise-managed access group. If an access group administrator in a child account adds a dynamic rule, they can always update or remove it.
Note that if conflicts arise between an update to this control and rules added or updated by an administrator in the child account, you must resolve those conflicts in the child account. This prevents breaking access that the rules might grant in the child account. For more information, see [Working with versions].

remove.description:
Action control for removing enterprise-managed dynamic rules in an enterprise-managed access group.
Note that if a rule is removed from an enterprise-managed access group by an administrator in a child account and and you reassign the template, the rule is reinstated.

AccessActionControls.description: Control whether or not access group administrators in child accounts can add access policies to the enterprise-managed access group in their account.

add.description:
Action control for adding access policies to an enterprise-managed access group in a child account. If an access group administrator in a child account adds a policy, they can always update or remove it.
Note that if conflicts arise between an update to this control in a new version and polices added to the access group by an administrator in a child account, you must resolve those conflicts in the child account. This prevents breaking access in the child account. For more information, see [Working with versions](https://cloud.ibm.com/docs/secure-enterprise?topic=secure-enterprise-working-with-versions#new-version-scenarios).

Members.description: Array of enterprise users to add to the template. All enterprise users that you add to the template must be invited to the child accounts where the template is assigned.

users.description: Array of enterprise users to add to the template. All enterprise users that you add to the template must be invited to the child accounts where the template is assigned.

services.description: Array of service IDs to add to the template

claim.description: The key in the key:value pair

operator.description: Compares the claim and the value

value.description: The value in the key:value pair

expiration.description: Session duration in hours. Access group membership is revoked after this time period expires. Users must log back in to refresh their access group membership.

conditions.description: Conditions of membership. You can think of this as a key:value pair.

rules.description: Dynamic rules to automatically add federated users to access groups based on specific identity attributes.

name.description: Give the access group a unique name that doesn't conflict with other templates access group name in the given account. This is shown in child accounts.

description.description: Access group description. This is shown in child accounts.

name.description: Give the access group a unique name that doesn't conflict with other templates access group name in the given account. This is shown in child accounts.

description.description: Access group description. This is shown in child accounts.

name.description: Give the access group template a unique name that doesn't conflict with an existing access group templates in the account.

description.description: Assign an optional description for the access group template.

account_id.description: Enterprise account id in which the template will be created.

policy_template_references.description: Existing policy templates that you can reference to assign access in the Access group input component

name.description: This is an optional field. If the field is included it will change the name value for all existing versions of the template..

description.description: Assign an optional description for the access group template version.

policy_template_references.description: The policy templates associated with the template version.

template_id.description: The unique identifier of the template to be assigned.

template_version.description: The version number of the template to be assigned.

target_type.description: The type of the entity to which the template should be assigned, e.g. 'Account', 'AccountGroup', etc.

target.description: The unique identifier of the entity to which the template should be assigned.

id.description: The ID of the access group template

name.description: The name of the access group template

description.description: The description of the access group template

account_id.description: The ID of the account to which the access group template is assigned

version.description: The version of the access group template

committed.description: A boolean indicating whether the access group template is committed. You must commit a template before you can assign it to child accounts.

policy_template_references.description: References to policy templates assigned to the access group template

href.description: The URL of the access group template resource

created_at.description: The date and time when the access group template was created

created_by_id.description: The ID of the user who created the access group template

last_modified_at.description: The date and time when the access group template was last modified

last_modified_by_id.description: The ID of the user who last modified the access group template

ListTemplateVersionsResponse.description: Response object for listing template versions

limit.description: The maximum number of IAM resources to return

offset.description: The offset of the first IAM resource in the list

total_count.description: The total number of IAM resources in the list

group_template_versions.description: A list of access group template versions

ListTemplateVersionResponse.description: Response object for a single access group template version

account_id.description: The ID of the account associated with the template

version.description: The version number of the template

committed.description: A boolean indicating whether the template is committed or not

policy_template_references.description: A list of policy templates associated with the template

href.description: The URL to the template resource

created_at.description: The date and time the template was created

created_by_id.description: The ID of the user who created the template

last_modified_at.description: The date and time the template was last modified

last_modified_by_id.description: The ID of the user who last modified the template

ListTemplateAssignmentResponse.description: Response object containing a list of template assignments

limit.description: Maximum number of items returned in the response

offset.description: Index of the first item returned in the response

total_count.description: Total number of items matching the query

TemplateAssignmentResponse.description: Response object containing the details of a template assignment

account_id.description: The ID of the account that the assignment belongs to

template_id.description: The ID of the template that the assignment is based on

template_version.description: The version of the template that the assignment is based on

target_type.description: The type of the entity that the assignment applies to

target.description: The ID of the entity that the assignment applies to

operation.description: The operation that the assignment applies to (e.g. 'assign', 'update', 'remove')

href.description: The URL of the assignment resource

created_at.description: The date and time when the assignment was created

created_by_id.description: The user or system that created the assignment

last_modified_at.description: The date and time when the assignment was last updated

last_modified_by_id.description: The user or system that last updated the assignment

ResourceListWithTargetAccountID.description: Object containing details of a resource list with target account ID

target.description: The ID of the entity that the resource list applies to

policy_template_references.description: List of policy template references for the resource list

TemplateAssignmentVerboseResponse.description: Response object containing the details of a template assignment

account_id.description: The ID of the account that the assignment belongs to

template_id.description: The ID of the template that the assignment is based on

template_version.description: The version of the template that the assignment is based on

target_type.description: The type of the entity that the assignment applies to

target.description: The ID of the entity that the assignment applies to

operation.description: The operation that the assignment applies to (e.g. 'create', 'update', 'delete')

resources.description: List of resources for the assignment

href.description: The URL of the assignment resource

created_at.description: The date and time when the assignment was created

created_by_id.description: The user or system that created the assignment

last_modified_at.description: The date and time when the assignment was last updated

last_modified_by_id.description: The user or system that last updated the assignment

members.description: List of member resources of the group.

rules.description: List of rules associated with the group.
